result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Jaurigue was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M Jaurigue

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 11:06 AM 
Defendant James M Jaurigue in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--no presence at the Watertown Walmart Store
--comply with any treatments, therapy or assessments per DOC
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges 

Days credit for time already served:  5  days
recess: 11:15am

Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] case called at 8:55am 
Defendant James M Jaurigue in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Jaurigue waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:59am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on  April 20th at 10:00am,  (2) Status Conference on June 16th at 11:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Conditions of this Bond include:
--no presence at the WalMart in Watertown

[MK] case called at 1:35pm 
Defendant James M Jaurigue appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties. Attorney Rumpf requests that the case be set for preliminary hearing on a date far enough out to allow time for the appointment of counsel. 

The Court requires a $750  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no presence at the WalMart in Watertown 
recess 1:40pm. 

NEXT: Prelminary Hearing on April 8th at 8:30am
